snippet: The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Science governing board will wrestle with a lack of diversity in its ranks and with poor ratings for the Feb. 28 Oscars telecast.
abstract: Fifty-one-member governing board of Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences will meet for annual review; will most likely focus on Oscar ceremony that suffered from bad ratings amid criticism about lack of nominations for non-white people; other issues include pressure from ABC to assert more control over ceremony.

byline.original: By MICHAEL CIEPLY and BROOKS BARNES

lead_paragraph: The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Science governing board will wrestle with a lack of diversity in its ranks and with poor ratings for the Feb. 28 Oscars telecast.

headline.main: Film Academy Governors Take On Race and Ratings
headline.print_headline: Backdrop Gets Messier for Academy Leaders
